thread.title: Sutton's pie-eating reserve goalie promises Piers Morgan he'll transfer to Arsenal in exchange for six Cornish pasties
thread.title_full: Sutton's pie-eating reserve goalie promises Piers Morgan he'll transfer to Arsenal in exchange for six Cornish pasties

author: Lara Martin
title: Sutton's pie-eating reserve goalie promises Piers Morgan he'll transfer to Arsenal in exchange for six Cornish pasties
text:
Alan Shearer recalls playing with Sutton's Wayne Shaw Share this video Watch Next 
Piers later commented to co-host Susanna Reid that Wayne had “restored” his faith in real athletes and praised his “winners’ mentality.” 
“It’s not about being a stick insect,” said Piers. “It’s about that desire to win - and eat pies.” 
Sutton United’s FA cup run ended when they lost to Arsenal in the fifth round, but Wayne had nothing but praise for the team. 
“It’s been very special. The lads have been fantastic. It was all about the lads. They’ve been super every round we’ve played in and they didn’t disgrace themselves last night,” he said. Piers urged Wayne to transfer to Arsenal (Photo: ITV) Read More Arsenal goalscorer Theo Walcott makes up for pennant snub by signing Sutton United shirts in dressing room 
As for his newfound global fame, he remained modest, simply saying: “It’s been crazy but like I say, without the lads I wouldn’t even be sat here.” 
Wayne was an unused substitute as the hosts went down 2-0 to the Gunners but still made headlines around the world, and even trended on Twitter. 
Goals in either half from Lucas Perez and Theo Walcott secured progress for Arsene Wenger's men, but plenty of people had long since decided to watch Shaw's antics instead of what was going on on the pitch. Read More Hit the bar at half-time and a pie in the dugout: Sutton keeper Wayne Shaw had a night to remember against Arsenal 
His manager, Paul Doswell, was less impressed than those who've taken the larger than life character to heart. 
"I think Wayne has become this global superstar on the back of being 23-stone. He's made that a chance to make some more media coverage off the back of it," Doswell said. 
"The reality is I don't know but it wouldn't surprise me. I don't think it shows us in the best light." 
*GMB airs weekdays from 6am on ITV. Like us on Facebook
